website_summaries.verdict: Sleek, basic, yet functional – the perfect model if you want a classic 2-slot toaster and to save a few dollars on this small appliance by a popular brand.
pros: Basic yet attractive, with slots that that are wide enough for bagels
Modern stainless steel finish in a 2-slot model that has a minimal footprint on your counter top
cons: A few discrepancies on how evenly it browns – some owners say it works as promised, while others gripe that 1 side of toasted bread is usually darker

customer_reviews.title: I liked it but it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I like it, but it never worked. The center heating element just got warm and didn't glow. Then after one use the control buttons didn't seem to do anything and it just got warm and didn't toast. I have returned it for a replacement because I like the product if it would work right. If the new one works out, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: StonyRiverDave

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money! Poor toasting!
customer_reviews.text: Burners do not toast evenly each side!! The exact reason I bought new being my more pricey and higher quality was doing the same after 4/5 years. I thought if I went more simple design and technology, I would be better off.......nope!! Right out of the box, toasting unevenly. And the dial setting for toasting time is incredibly hard to get just right. I little change on the dial goes a long way, or not, depending on which side of the burner it is.. sigh
customer_reviews.author: sharon ursi

customer_reviews.title: Mfg. tells me it’s discontinued
customer_reviews.text: So it’s exactly the size and color I needed. BUT...the device never shuts off once the toaster is started on any setting & the cancel button doesn’t do anything. Oster said it’s a discontinued item so they won’t say any more on the topic. As long as I stand there and manually pop items it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Masterhoda

customer_reviews.title: If you like to toast every slice twice . . .
customer_reviews.text: Amazon recommended a different one. Should have listened. Toast one side, turn bread over, toast other side. Many heating elements don't turn red and get hot. Worst toaster I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! After about 2 months it started toasting the left edge of the bread charcoal black and the right side un-toasted even though the toaster showed no signs of internal malfunction with the heating elements. Recently after Toasting the bread - the toast began taking on the smell of the electric appliance! plus you can’t clean the inside of it above the catch tray you’re stuck with the crumbs sitting at the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Karen Burns

customer_reviews.title: Wary of finish
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked the toaster yesterday and while the finish is as cherry red and shiny as described, this one had scratches in the finish at the top where it is quite noticable. It did not appear to have been used though the box had previously been opened. I won't return the toaster, we need to use it. And besides, it isn't worth the bother since this finish will likely be scratched in use. Had I to do it over I'd choose a finish that is likely to be more durable. On the plus side, it toasted our bread ;-)
customer_reviews.author: merrycyclist

customer_reviews.title: My toast Burns, I am toast
customer_reviews.text: Within the first month the temperature control quit working correctly. So when you adjust the temp for toasting, you have to guess between darker and lighter, a lot of times the today Burns. We have only used it 5x, but we are 2 days after the 30 day return possiblity, so we are stuck with it :(
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: no longer toasts - bought it just under 2 months ago
customer_reviews.text: i have no idea if the seller/producer reads these reviews....but just in case you do - i'd appreciate help with a credit or return. i honestly don't know how to proceed. i had an oyster toaster for 20 years and it was perfect until it popped a wire...but it was such a great toaster and for so long that i thought, i'll just buy another one. now, i have a toaster that worked great for the first month and then declined over the past 2 weeks....now it 'toasts' but only for 30 seconds and......le sigh, that doesn't really toast anything. what to do - i'd also love any ideas on other toasters to buy, etc..... thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: spacecake

customer_reviews.title: great toaster
customer_reviews.text: After reading numerous toaster reviews, it seemed that all new toasters toast unevenly, regardless of price. That includes some up to $300! (why would you spend that much?) Thankfully, this one toasts very evenly, our most important criteria. (how hard can that be?!) Two very long slots hold the longest slices of bread, but also hold 4 regular slices at once, if desired. Easy controls, consistent temperature, easier than our last toaster to remove bits of toast from the bottom. Extra thick bread like bagels also fit easily, and are held centered and toast evenly. My only complaint is that the lifting function does not raise short slices enough to grab easily.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: I DO NOT RECOMMEND! Broke down a few months after I purchased it.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not last at all! It stopped working a few months after I bought it! It is a very beautiful toaster, but it does not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Mallaly Aleman

customer_reviews.title: Poor toaster
customer_reviews.text: My family hates this toaster. Seriously, we never know what temp to use due to inconsistency. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Real Life Byron

customer_reviews.title: Never thought a simple toaster could be this bad!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds cheap and tinny when lowering toast. Needs to be toasted more than one time, regardless of what the shade selector is set for. Now, 4 months later, the bread does not stay down. Have to hold it down manually to get toast. Has been thoroughly cleaned so nothing is in the way. Does look nice, but don't buy if you want toast and not just a decoration.
customer_reviews.author: eileen a

customer_reviews.title: Half toast
customer_reviews.text: As previous reviewers stated: only toastes on half of bread! Not one SIDE...one half! When looking at the heating element good half are flat to the toaster not bowed like they should be and do not glow red like they should. Got this to replace same older model toaster that worked great for over 10 years but this thing is worse than the 10 year old one on its last leg!
customer_reviews.author: Salena Lundquist

customer_reviews.title: MANY FEATURES AND DECORATIVE
customer_reviews.text: This Toaster is so pretty and has many features I want. I eat bagels occasionally and it even has a button for just bagels! Also, has a warm feature, a cancel feature which I use when rushed, a toast feature, and a nice crumb tray. One of the BEST UNRECOGNIZED features nationally, is when the toast is BELOW the top of the toaster - just push up the "start" lever and it RAISES the toast so you can pick it up easily without digging into the slots to get your toast!!!!! The many hours I spent analyzing all the toasters and prices was well worth it to find this Oster pretty and practical Toaster! I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Mary J. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Love the look
customer_reviews.text: Like this toaster. Would get a 5 star rating if it were just a little bit taller / bigger to fit sour dough bread which is oblong. I didn't want the 4 slice because of complaints of uneven browning, which you don't get with a 2 slice toaster. So is a little larger than my previous toaster, but one more inch would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Carol M.

customer_reviews.title: WORST TOASTER OF ALL TIMES!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst toaster I’ve ever had. Since when does a toaster only roast on one side when it doesn’t say one side. It toasts on one side on both sides of the toaster. I just thru this so called toaster in the garbage,and will never buy another Oster product as long as I live. I’ve shared this info with a lot of people as they have similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I paid $30 for this toaster! It does not toast evenly, you have to flip the bread several times to get all sides toasted. It also takes FOREVER on high to get the bread toasted at all!
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Threw It Out
customer_reviews.text: This toaster only lasted 3 months. From the first day it was a problem to operate. It always wanted to toast on the "frozen" setting. It took repeated attempts every time the toaster was used to turn off the "frozen" setting. After only 3 months of use, the toaster would not stay in the down/toast position by itself; it had to be held down manually. In addition, one side of each toast slot stopped working so I had to toast one side (holding the toast down manually) and then flip the bread around to toast the other side (again holding it down manually). A huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Blank Board

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t even last 2 year. IZ’m so disappointed in this toaster. One diced started getting very hot and within seconds burning the bread the other side didn’t work at all. What a complete waste of money. I threw it out because I was afraid it would burn my house down.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: The electrical cord is so short. Makes it inconvent and cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda DeBeatham

customer_reviews.title: Color Ready
customer_reviews.text: Wife changing her color scheme, thought this was great very quick shipment great price highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: amplify2

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. Have had it for a year now. Functions well, toasts evenly and heats bagels nicely. It looks great in my kitchen I love the finish.
customer_reviews.author: Ariauna

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy and disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product at all.When I push down the leaver it keeps popping back up and I have to do that about ten to twelve times before I can toast two slices of bread. I am so disappointed because I ordered this brand and model number because I had the same type before and it worked for about ten years before I replaced it with this one.VERY VERY UNHAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good replacement...
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit itself. Sometimes the lever used to start the toasting process does not fully engage. I may have to push it again to start toasting bread. But, for the most part I give it 4 stars. It's not as heavy as the previous Oster this one replaces. I like the color!
customer_reviews.author: The Mozell

customer_reviews.title: second oster toaster returned
customer_reviews.text: toasted the 1st and 2nd. time it would not go down to toast. Had to hold control button down to get it to toast. Returned the second oster toaster.
customer_reviews.author: judy r.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality toaster
customer_reviews.text: After a week, only toasted one side. Control buttons never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Brown

customer_reviews.title: Keep your eye on degree of toasting.
customer_reviews.text: Toast is hard to judge which number control works best.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple little toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I love the looks of this toaster, and it does a good job of keeping settings simple and getting toast toasted nice and evenly, with good consistency between toastings.
customer_reviews.author: SteveTCook

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking with one drawback
customer_reviews.text: The drawback or design flaw is that smaller items do not pop up out of the machine far enough to easily grab with your fingers, temping one to stick a fork in there. Don't do that!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Still on the hunt, like so many others!
customer_reviews.text: The dial, I find is very hard to read, along with the buttons. My toaster does not have black writing above the buttons, it is a very light blue making it hard to read on the stainless steel. Although pretty, not functional (the light is also blue). Toasting I find is fine one day, not so much the next. I wanted the long slots and there are few options out there. The high lift option is also very minimal, slightly over 1/4 inch, I still needed toaster tongs. I, like so many others, can't find a decent toaster. Just a simple toaster that toasts! (OK, and looks good).
customer_reviews.author: bluebox

customer_reviews.title: OK not great
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to the reviews that say this toasts unevenly. It was great for the first couple months, but now in order to get toast instead of heated bread I nearly always get one burned edge or corner that needs to be scraped off. This is most certainly not the most expensive toaster around, but I've had other, even cheaper models that were more consistent -- they just didn't toast diferent widths of bread as well. a ridiculous inconsistency
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Adams

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is a light indicating what control I am using
customer_reviews.author: Techairashop

customer_reviews.title: This toaster does a good job but it not do as good as the ...
customer_reviews.text: This toaster does a good job but it not do as good as the picture shows. I bake my own read and my loaves are usually larger on one end than the other end. I have to cut each slice in half but can toast both slices at the same time. The half slice will not reach the top even with the riser. I am going to order a bamboo tweezer to lift them out. One tremendous thing I really like is the ability to put frozen bread or waffles etc. and it works very good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moravetz    thisis a book every body should read as it will help them to find

customer_reviews.title: I had one for over 3 years that's still working just fine, so when I moved
customer_reviews.text: It toasts things. It looks cute. I had one for over 3 years that's still working just fine, so when I moved, I got another one just like it because it's reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: Not kitchen red - this is candy apple or metallic red in color
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and the look, however what it did not say was that it was candy-apple or metallic red and something that simply would not go in the kitchen. Perhaps this would be better in a man cave next to a 57 Chevy. Too bad because other than the misrepresentation on the color, I liked the design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Frequent Flyer

customer_reviews.title: You have to work with it to find the right setting for the degree of toasting that you enjoy, but that's it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the exact same product which I have owned for 12 years and the new one is performing just as well. It is a fairly unique toaster in that it accommodates irregularly shaped slices of bread. You have to work with it to find the right setting for the degree of toasting that you enjoy, but that's it. My first one of these endured daily use by 2-3 people daily for 12 years. That's about all one can reasonably ask from a toaster and this one delivers.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Narrow and fits well on counter top.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but needs a "product lift" button. Sometimes difficult to get out without touching toaster. Doesn't work consistently; sometimes takes 2 mins. sometimes 3 mins. on "toast". Guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: The toaster works just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to purchase this item because of the reviews. I’m glad I got it and didn’t listen to people who probably just don’t know how to cook! (Lol) I believe the people who were burning their toast set it on 5 frozen item. I toast my daughters frozen waffles on 3.5 frozen and it works great. The key is to start off at 1 or 2 and work your way up to how you like your items toasted. Slow and steady wins the race!
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: Toasts nicely, no longer have to cut slices in half
customer_reviews.text: Within a week of morning use, the toaster developed a high pitched noise while toasting. Still works good, but noise is a little irritating, especially for something only a week old. They just don't make things like they used too :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks Better Than It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice Controls w/LED lights; Looks nice inside and out. Cons: Hot to touch; Does not slide around counter easily; When you go to remove toast using the lever as an assist, the lever does not raise the toast high enough out of the toaster to keep from burning finger tips...at least mine; toasting inconsistent. I would return it if I could but it's now been used. I'll do my depreciation thing over the next year and give it to Good Will; and then buy something else after doing a little more research. I had a nice Phillips for 10 years but was unable to locate another.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Great Seller! Item as described
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a toaster in some time and really missed toasting some of my sandwiches. You can also toast thicker pieces (like French toast or Bagels). Love this little toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I wish the short cord were attached at the opposite end than the controls on this long toaster so I could position it in the narrow space on my counter next to my microwave, but for some reason the manufacturer attached the cord near the control end. Now it has to take up more space on the counter. Otherwise, the toaster is attractive and performs well. The long slots allow me to toast our family's favorite long slices of fresh baked sourdough bread without having to cut them in half.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Matches my color theme easy to use. Con: Doesn’t heat the toast equally on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Lupe M

customer_reviews.title: This is actually a burner, not a toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is more like a Russian roulette machine for bread. Usually the first piece of toast is okay, but after that it's more of a 'burner' than a toaster. Sometimes you get lucky and it only burns half of your toast.
customer_reviews.author: s roy

customer_reviews.title: Kinda' Burned by Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Toaster does fine until you put in the 3 or 4 slices it was supposed to be meant to handle and then it doesn't SPRING UP and say DING! when the toast is ready so you don't get your toast nice and hot. You sort of look around and say, "Isn't that toast ready yet?" and by golly, it is, but it is cold because you didn't know it so it just grew cold sitting there waiting for you to notice. Also, because it isn't strong enough to spring up you have to take hold of the handle and pull the toast up. Definition of our insanity? We never fail to be disappointed by this quirk!
customer_reviews.author: Suzarita

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great, toaster
customer_reviews.text: This toaster has settings for frozen bread, and a warm option. There is a dial for selecting how much you want your bread toasted. Overall the toaster is pretty small, so I keep it in a cupboard when I am not using it to reduce clutter in my small kitchen. It seems to work equally well for frozen and non-frozen breads, English muffins, and bagels. When I use the warm cycle, it doesn't over-burn my toast. My only gripe is that I often have to toast it for two or more "cycles" to achieve the perfect dark brown toast.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Really good toaster..you'll like it.
customer_reviews.text: Thus is a great toaster and a very reasonable price. It's a delight to have my bread toasted on both sides. I tossed an expensive Toastmaster out. You will like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Orphanannie

customer_reviews.title: Subpar toaster
customer_reviews.text: My toaster quit working within 6 months of purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toaster is all it claims to be.
customer_reviews.text: We loved the brushed finished on the toaster, very pretty. It has the controls we need and wanted and will take care of big slices of bread and bagels also. We are very happy with the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Debrah Warren

customer_reviews.title: Nice design and price
customer_reviews.text: I finally purchased a new toaster after 18 years of marriage. This product is very solid and looks great on my kitchen counter. I do not like a lot of items on the kitchen countertop but it’s sleek design brings style. It’s an great price and product
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Chavis

customer_reviews.title: Not great but usable
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice over all but one huge drawback. It only toasts on one side no matter which slot you use.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Penny

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product reliability
customer_reviews.text: Really like the toaster until the handle stopping staying down and it’s not the old. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars seemed to little but im not happy with 4 either. the reason is the my toast has to be rotated during EVERY use of this toaster. it only toasts half of the bread. I have tried flipping the toast and rotating the toast. There is no solution other than toasting for half a cycle then fliping the bread and toasting agian. It looks really nice. it is really easy to keep clean it is really easy to empty the crumbs and eay to wind up the cord and put in the cabinet
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toast every time
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. It has two really long and really wide bread holders so you can toast thick or thin slices. We use it often for thick bagels and it works great and can comfortably toast two full large bagels at a time. it also has special buttons for toasting bread that's frozen and for bagels. Oh, and did I mention that it looks great! We've been using it for a year now and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My previous toaster worked perfectly for over 15 years. I replaced it with this Oster and wish I had kept the box to send it back. Cancel button is stuck in. Have to turn the heat dial all the way to 7 to get the bread to brown. I should have tried to have my previous repaired
customer_reviews.author: Karen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Only OK
customer_reviews.text: He toaster is attractive and looks nice on the counter. It replaced a previous version of this model, and the build and quality are diminished. Toast is not uniform, and it varies a bit with each slice. Should have checked Consumer Reports first.
customer_reviews.author: idahotom

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it matched my microwave. No issues, works great. Looks good too!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kalb

customer_reviews.title: Broke already
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster 7 months ago, and with very minimal use, it broke and won't toast. Another thing to note is that the toaster "rings" when it is toasting (very annoying). Oh, and very uneven toasting. But it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Colin M.

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. The slots are large enough and wide enough to handle almost anything. The controls are easy to use and it does a nice job of toasting. The last toaster I had was a single slot version from Oster and I had been using it for a long time. The reason for buying this one was two slots instead of one. I expect that, based on my experience with my prior Oster toaster, this one will also last a long time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Leland C. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous red color. Priced right.
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. Live the lift-up handle for shorter bread slices and English muffins. Priced right and great red color.
customer_reviews.author: Roni Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great toaster but when we got it the plastic smelt so bad I almost sent it back didn’t want to make toast or bagels in it but the smell went away I made toast and took a couple of bites it was fine but it was really nasty smell
customer_reviews.author: jolene

customer_reviews.title: Great little toaster, but....
customer_reviews.text: Great little toaster, but.... full size bagels and regular bread doesn't quite fit unless you poke it down a little. It misses by about 1/4 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Griff Evans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toaster
customer_reviews.text: This our second Oster 6330 toaster. The first one we had stopped ejecting after several years of high use. We use it a lot for toasting bagels and English Muffins - we have one or the other (or both) almost every day. It has a button that is useful if the item being toasted is frozen. That will thaw it and then toast it, without burning it or drying it out. The fact that we replaced the old one with the exact same model should tell you that we really like this toaster!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I was initially pleased with the nice look of the toaster. I used it maybe once or twice week and after 6 months the lift cradle that holds the toast broke off on one side and it not usable. Any more it seems like you take a chance with the quality of cheap made overseas electronics. It is my third toaster over the last few years of various brands. I may try to find a used one made back in the days when they were made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: retiresoon

customer_reviews.title: Not working after only 5 months
customer_reviews.text: The button that you push to lock toast in the toasting position won’t stay down so won’t toast.
customer_reviews.author: ChristyO

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that it shows every finger print and they are hard to get off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: spring didnt hold bread down.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a toaster in years and lately I found myself wanting one again so instead of driving to the store to buy one, I went with this cheap little thing. That's exactly what it was. I plugged it in, and it would not hold the toast down. So obviously its not helpful lol shipped it back for a refund. Oster is a cheap brand. Spend the $40 on a decent, durable toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Kittykins

customer_reviews.title: Bread
customer_reviews.text: a lot of the breads i buy are just a hair to wide for the slot and if the bread has a bend or fold it won't fit at all but this toaster works great for the price. If you don't have a lot of cash to blow on a toaster this is the toaster for you!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chong

customer_reviews.title: I love my toaster
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to clean and i love all the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: A new recipe for toast !
customer_reviews.text: I have finally achieved English muffin nirvana. This puppy is as efficient as it is snappy looking. The settings and preset buttons are simple and efficient. The "cancel" button is an added feature that allows pop up on demand. It is a good deal from a good brand name. Once again I minimized the carbon footprint thing. Just hit a button and wait for the delivery van. Rather than drive to shop I let the packages ""carpool". Sorry OPEC and global warming, you lose.
customer_reviews.author: galvinci

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought in September and it failed in June. Was never great in terms of toasting ability. Either too little or too much.
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: This toaster delivers!
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews gave indicate a possible issue with toasting consistently on both sides. I ended up purchasing this toaster anyway because I prefer the slice handling capabilities of long slot toasters and, quite frankly, there aren't many offerings in the < $100 price range. Maybe I just got lucky, but I've been pleased with this toaster: it looks nice, works as advertised, and toasts bread evenly. But, as with any mass produced item, "your mileage may vary".
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Shiny
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it appealing to the eye but it makes the best toast !
customer_reviews.author: MsRedRebelRose

customer_reviews.title: i wouldn't even call this thing a toaster.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give less stars I would. No matter what setting I cannot get a piece of toast that isn't burnt half burned or stripes of burned and stripes of untoasted. I will go to bb&b with a coupon and look for a decent toaster with the bars instead of the awful heated wires that this thing has.
customer_reviews.author: eBookFoodie

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is pretty
customer_reviews.text: I like the pull out tray that collects the crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: We had an Oster before that lasted many years. I have to agree with some of the previous comments, it is hard to read the settings. The print is too light. Also, the bread seems to get darker on the bottom. I'm not fussy, as far as returning stuff, so I just scrape it with a knife if it's too done.
customer_reviews.author: Sally J Orlow

customer_reviews.title: nice looking only!
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and nice looking. We eat wheat bread ,bagels and sour dough. each one needs a different setting. toast may burn at level 2. bagal button works well but you need to remember to change dial again or your going to burn the toast. Our toast browns more at the bottom than at the top also. If your picky this toaster is not the one. someday we will have an a sensor that will automatically toast each one perfect without adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: rnman

customer_reviews.title: Oster is the Best
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is attractive, looks nice with my breadbox et al. It feels like quality but surprisingly the knob quit holding itself down & then it quit heating at all. But I contacted Oster. They asked me a few brief questions & sent me a new one. That's it. The new one has given me no trouble. I am very happy with the product but more importantly with the company.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy L.

customer_reviews.title: Matches my kitchen and works well
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice toaster, works well, is elegant, beautiful and matches with the reddish colors of my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: Over priced. quality of toaster is cheap. Bread is toasted uneven
customer_reviews.author: Leticia

customer_reviews.title: no happy medium. Emailed Oster but never heard back from ...
customer_reviews.text: Toast is either to dark or to light on one side, no happy medium. Emailed Oster but never heard back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Jo

customer_reviews.title: When Toast needs to be Toasted, This gets the Job Done.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty standard toaster. It gets the job done for making toast. There are settings if you wish to use bagels instead of bread. Nothing too spectacular about this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Nas

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Comes with few scratches on the front black panel, then I don't have time to go and return, used the sharpie and clear off the scratches myself
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Crap for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought a nice toaster to replace the cheap one that had uneven toasting. Got a more expensive toaster that has uneven toasting (Very large Hot Spot in the middle) and a catch on the lever that only catches and hold down to toast 1 out of every 3 tries. Maybe it is my unit, but I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Kinne

customer_reviews.title: Brave little toaster
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a no frills inexpensive toaster for my mom. This is perfect. Doesn’t take up a lot of space. Easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: srm

customer_reviews.title: No wonder it was inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Everything is nice about this thing until it goes to pop out the toast. If you are toating anything heavier than a piece of white wonder bread, which is 80% air anyway, the return action isn't stron enough to lift the item. So you have to finish the job manually. Really now, you think this could have been rectified with a strong spring or something. More plastic junk for a plastic world.
customer_reviews.author: the buzzard

customer_reviews.title: Heating element defective.
customer_reviews.text: The toaster doesn’t heat the bread/bagel. The heating element apparently doesn’t work and if you’re trying to toast a bagel the toast light I comes on automatically. My previous Oster allowed you to select the bagel prior to starting the process.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Elsey

customer_reviews.title: Awful toaster!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It only toasts one side of the bread. Most awful toaster I have ever purchased. I had to replace it. Only thing I like about it is how it looks. Not worth any amount of money. Do not buy this toaster. If you want a red one, buy the Black & Decker. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J.

customer_reviews.title: Stylish toaster
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster. The settings, especially the cancel button, are great. Like other reviewers mentioned (and as the photo indicates), the red finish is shiny as opposed to matte, but I like the shiny finish much better. Yes, it's plastic, as other reviewers noted, but I don't think it's cheap looking. I like the way it looks so much that I leave it out on my counter. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sally O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a toaster and saw this one! Love the red metallic color as well as its functions!! Easy to use and does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one for the color. which is a beautiful red and very rich looking. I wanted a 4 slot toaster but it seemed there were very few at amazon at that time so i settled for the two slot version and was very pleased with it. Two slots was not a deal breaker as it is only my husband and I. Glad i made the choice I did
customer_reviews.author: Tender Mercy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Bread keeps popping up - have to push down a few times to keep it down to toast. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. Does a great job, even with bagels. Toasts very evenly. And it's pretty!
customer_reviews.author: musemama

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle, best of the bunch I looked at on Amazon and in Target.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, easy to handle and use design. Would have preferred a longer power cord, though. Does a first rate job on those pesky bagel halves in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: Al Mongeon

customer_reviews.title: Long slots are great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when my old toaster started acting up. Like the long slots, great for those slices in the middle of a round loaf that refuse to go into a regular slotted toaster. Recommend starting it out on a lighter setting than you're used to, or you can burn the first few slices like I did! Oster has always been a good company and this toaster is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Granted the super cool heat settings have begun to become very inaccurate ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 7 or so year ago and it is still going. Granted the super cool heat settings have begun to become very inaccurate but you are just burning bread so to speak so how accurate does it need to be. Its getting dirtier and more scratched up by the day from life but it shows no sign of going out or having any issues other than the loss in temp accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Peterson

customer_reviews.title: It’s really cute😃
customer_reviews.text: Well, the toast is not consistently toasted on both sides. I use it to make toast!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M. Bane

customer_reviews.title: Oster really stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.text: Like the looks of it. But, the first time I used it, the "toast" button jammed and was not able to try the other buttons. Very upsetting, having it break first time I used it. Looked up warranty and called Oster customer service. They were so nice, and am sending me a new toaster free of charge. Hope this one works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item is exactly as described.  Would highly recommend♡♡♡
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this toaster, used but a few times, like cancel and other features. Hoping this toaster outlives my other one, without finish coming off.
customer_reviews.author: PuPu

customer_reviews.title: I Just Love It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say?????????? Except that I just love my new toaster!!!! My favorite feature is the little button on the side I can press to pop out the toast before the timer setting!!! I wanted a RED toaster to match my kitchen, and this fits in perfectly with my decor....... but the best part about it is that it works perfectly!!! LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Readalot

product_meta.title: Oster 2-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless Steel (006594-000-000)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFeaturing Advanced Toasting Technology, the Oster 2-Slice Toaster ensures consistent, even results every time. This toaster features extra-wide slots with auto-adjusting bread guides to accommodate a wide variety of bread types including traditional sliced bread, English muffins, specialty breads, and thick bagels. Seven toast shade settings let you choose from dark to light options for customized toasting. An anti-jam feature automatically shuts your toaster off in case of a jam for safe, hassle-free operation, while a cancel setting lets you stop the toasting process at any time. This 2-slice toaster also offers a frozen option to heat up cold pastries, waffles, and pancakes and a warm setting that is perfect for warming bread. A toast-lift lever allows you to retrieve your food easily, and a removable crumb tray offers simple cleanup. The Oster 2-Slice Toaster features a stylish brushed stainless steel design to match any kitchen décor.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
2-Slice Toaster
feature_bullets: 2-slice toaster offers 7 shade settings for customized toasting
Extra-wide, long slots and auto-adjusting guides fit a variety of bread types
Anti-jam feature automatically turns off toaster for added safety
Removable, dishwasher-safe crumb tray for easy cleanup
Sleek stainless steel design complements any kitchen décor

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
